intro: Spermacoce gilliesiae, commonly known as the silverleaf false pimpernel, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence, giving it its common name. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas with good drainage. Spermacoce gilliesiae is an herbaceous perennial that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing several seeds.
